title: @Riot Why revert the Zed ult changes?
body: I'd like some context as to why you guys reverted the change to his ult. It seemed like a healthy change in power. It would force zed players to commit while nerfing his ability to ult in and run away.

replies.body:
because he's not OP to begin with

He's kept intentionally weak right now to allow for his high ceiling

He retains nigh-50% win ratio while being picked in 1/3rd of games he is not banned in.

He is many things but "weak" isn't one of them.

This meme that high playrate champs should have low win rates needs to die.

I suck at league, but I know science and statistics and it doesn't work like that.

not a meme, the moment that both are true is the moment that you should be realizing that the champion is too easy for how much power they can output, and the best way to counteract it is straight nerfs.

It's not science and stats, it's common sense.

A champ with a high pickrate is played a lot by a lot of people while a champ with a low pick rate is played a lot by dedicated mains.

For as long as I've been on the boards (since just before that Shurima event that launched Azir and gutted Cassiopeia, which was about 2 years ago), there have always been threads complaining about Zed. Sure, Lee Sin was the poster problem child because of his dominance in the jungle, but Zed was always being complained about. He may have taken backseat to other champs, but the fact that there has always remained a vocal distaste for him shows that he's always been an issue and will always remain an issue until they give him meaningful corrections to pull him in line with mana users.

The problem was that this season Zed gets 2 fucking ults because of {{item:3147}} . If his Ult proc doesnt kill you the damn item passive proc will. Plus with QSS and Zhonya nerfs Zed's little counter play is therefor eliminated so his power is increased.

Essentially, they want to see how big an impact the Q change has first due to how big an impact any shift in its power has on Zed's kit. They still have the R change on tap to go if needed.

They're probably not the exact changes they want done to him, but I believe they said they're in the right direction. Changes are pulled from the PBE quite often and those same champions end up with different changes on the following patch. Riot is aware Zed is a balance issue, as seen in some other threads.
